intro: Rondeletia ricoae, commonly known as the yellow rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display. Rondeletia ricoae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
